page.title: 03Parish of Weeton St Michael
page.content: The recently-elected church warden has lived in the village for seven years.{The Parish of Weeton St Michael has a population of almost 2,500. Sunday{congregations}are small, over 30 in the morning and about a dozen in the evening. Special services, such as the monthly family service and the Harvest Festival, are better attended. On Plough Sunday, ploughs are taken into the school playground and blessed. Easter communicants number about 150. Financial giving is increasing. The church remains a{focal point} {of rural life}and is well-supported even by those who are not regular church-goers. Every year, a Garden Party and Christmas Fair are held. There is a{joint service}each year with the local Roman Catholic church.
